meanings.definition: To officially join or register in a program or organization.
meanings.sent1: I will enrol in the art class next week.
meanings.sent2: She decided to enrol in the dance club at school.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to enrol in the swim team, but they said no.
meanings.sent4: His heart wanted to enrol in the adventure, but his mind held him back.
meanings.sent5: Enrolling in the cooking class made her feel excited and eager to learn.

meanings.definition: To sign up or enlist for a service or activity.
meanings.sent1: They need to enrol for the volunteer program at the shelter.
meanings.sent2: He will enrol for the basketball tournament this weekend.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to enrol for the dog training class, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts began to enrol in the idea of traveling the world.
meanings.sent5: Enrolling for the charity run filled him with a sense of purpose and determination.
